summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York agreeing that transcripts of Ghislaine Maxwell's depositions from April and July 2016 are true and accurate copies and may be received as evidence at trial. The document is signed by the U.S. Attorney and Maxwell's defense attorneys.

events.title: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell was taken in New York, New York. The transcript is marked as SDNY_GM_000143740 through SDNY_GM_00144203.

events.title: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A second deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell was taken in New York, New York. The transcript is marked as SDNY_GM_00144204 through SDNY_GM_00144423.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The U.S. Attorney and Maxwell's defense team filed a stipulation agreeing that the 2016 deposition transcripts are true and accurate copies and may be used as evidence at trial.

keyFacts: The document is a stipulation agreeing that transcripts of Ghislaine Maxwell's depositions from April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016, are true and accurate copies.
The stipulated deposition transcripts were intended to be received as Government exhibits at Maxwell's criminal trial, subject to standard legal objections.
The stipulation was filed in November 2021, indicating the ongoing pre-trial evidence authentication process in Maxwell's case (S2 20 CR 330).
The document shows coordination between the prosecution (led by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams) and Maxwell's defense team (four named attorneys) on evidentiary matters.
